author: Immanuel Kant

core_concepts.definition: Objects conform to our cognition, not the other way around.
We can only know things as they appear to us (phenomena), never as they are in themselves (noumena).
Space and time are a priori forms of intuition that structure all experience.
Innate concepts (causality, substance, unity) applied to sensory data to make coherent experience.
Knowledge that is both informative and independent of experience, such as mathematics and basic laws of science.
